title: URF Chiptune
body:
The Story:

So Riot recently just finished that API challenge.  As it happens, my roommates entered (and got runner-up, you can check it out here: http://red3141.github.io/UrfChallenge2015/ )

Anyway, you'll notice it doesn't have any music.  While I'm not sure what the original plan was there, one morning I woke up and thought - I can do that.  So I dusted off my old milkytracker (which I never really learned to use in the first place) and got to work.  Since the game is all about URF, I found a recording of the URF login-screen music and decided to re-create it, chip-tune style.

About half-way through the process, I discovered they couldn't use it since that'd be three people.  Too bad, I finished it anyway.

Some notes:

I never actually learned milkytracker before so this was my first project and a huge learning experience.  If there are things you think suck - they probably do.  I _probably_ am already aware of them, but please let me know your suggestions or criticisms.

You'll notice the lack of manatee sounds - I was too lazy to make an extra 6 sequences to add random things to it.

Erm, yeah.  Have fun and stuff!

replies.body: hahaha! this is awesome! great work dude.
This is sweet! I love chiptunes! I'd have a chiptune version of every song in the world if I could.

Any requests?  :P

But seriously, I learned way more trying to figure how to do something that needed to be done than I ever did without.
